intro: Calcitrapa parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered calcitrapa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a prominent midrib and a hairy surface. Calcitrapa parviflora is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia.
